001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
006
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * Interface with default methods for a strongly-typed JSON-RPC client that uses Jackson to map from JSON to Java Objects.
012 */
013public interface JacksonRpcClient extends JsonRpcClient {
014
015    ObjectMapper getMapper();
016
017    JavaType getDefaultType();
018
019    default JavaType responseTypeFor(JavaType resultType) {
020        return getMapper().getTypeFactory().
021                constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
022    }
023
024    default JavaType responseTypeFor(Class<?> resultType) {
025        return getMapper().getTypeFactory().
026                constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
027    }
028
029    default JavaType typeForClass(Class<?> clazz) {
030        return getMapper().constructType(clazz);
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * Send a {@link JsonRpcRequest} for a {@link JsonRpcResponse}
035     * <p>Subclasses must implement this method to actually send the request
036     * @param <R> Type of result object
037     * @param request The request to send
038     * @param responseType The response type expected (used by Jackson for conversion)
039     * @return A JSON RPC Response with `result` of type `R`
040     * @throws IOException network error
041     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
042     */
043    <R> JsonRpcResponse<R> sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType responseType) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException;
044
045    /**
046     * Convenience method for requesting a response with a {@link JsonNode} for the result.
047     * @param request The request to send
048     * @return A JSON RPC Response with `result` of type {@code JsonNode}
049     * @throws IOException network error
050     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
051     */
052    default JsonRpcResponse<JsonNode> sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest request) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
053        return sendRequestForResponse(request, responseTypeFor(JsonNode.class));
054    }
055
056    private <R> R sendRequestForResult(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType resultType) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
057        JsonRpcResponse<R> response = sendRequestForResponse(request, responseTypeFor(resultType));
058
059//        assert response != null;
060//        assert response.getJsonrpc() != null;
061//        assert response.getJsonrpc().equals("2.0");
062//        assert response.getId() != null;
063//        assert response.getId().equals(request.getId());
064
065        if (response.getError() != null && response.getError().getCode() != 0) {
066            throw new JsonRpcStatusException(
067                    response.getError().getMessage(),
068                    200,    // If response code wasn't 200 we couldn't be here
069                    null,
070                    response.getError().getCode(),
071                    null,
072                    response);
073        }
074        return response.getResult();
075    }
076    
077    /**
078     * JSON-RPC remote method call that returns 'response.result`
079     *
080     * @param <R> Type of result object
081     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
082     * @param resultType desired result type as a Java class object
083     * @param params JSON RPC params
084     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response converted to type R
085     */
086    @Override
087    default <R> R send(String method, Class<R> resultType, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
088        // Construct a JavaType object so we can tell Jackson what type of result we are expecting.
089        // (We can't use R because of type erasure)
090//        JavaType responseType = mapper.getTypeFactory().
091//                constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
092        return sendRequestForResult(buildJsonRequest(method, params), typeForClass(resultType));
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * JSON-RPC remote method call that returns 'response.result`
097     *
098     * @param <R> Type of result object
099     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
100     * @param resultType desired result type as a Jackson JavaType object
101     * @param params JSON RPC params
102     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response converted to type R
103     */
104    default <R> R send(String method, JavaType resultType, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
105        // Construct a JavaType object so we can tell Jackson what type of result we are expecting.
106        // (We can't use R because of type erasure)
107        //JavaType responseType = mapper.getTypeFactory().
108        //        constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, resultType);
109        return sendRequestForResult(buildJsonRequest(method, params), resultType);
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Varargs version
114     */
115    default <R> R send(String method, JavaType resultType, Object... params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
116        return sendRequestForResult(buildJsonRequest(method, params), resultType);
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Call an RPC method and return default object type.
121     *
122     * Caller should cast returned object to the correct type.
123     *
124     * Useful for:
125     * * Dynamically-dispatched JSON-RPC methods calls via Groovy subclasses
126     * * Simple (not client-side validated) command line utilities
127     * * Functional tests that need to send incorrect types to the server to test error handling
128     *
129     * @param <R> Type of result object
130     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
131     * @param params JSON RPC parameters as a `List`
132     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response cast to type R
133     * @throws IOException network error
134     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
135     */
136    @Override
137    default <R> R send(String method, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
138        return send(method, getDefaultType(), params);
139    }
140}
